title: How Do I Know If I Have  Chronic Fatigue Syndrome?
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

content: There’s no simple blood test or X-ray to diagnose chronic fatigue syndrome – also known as myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS). And many of the symptoms of the illness -- deep tiredness, unrelieved by rest or sleep, feeling worse after physical or mental exertion, trouble concentrating, feeling worse after standing and remaining on one’s feet and other symptoms-- are also seen in other conditions, too, making the diagnosis of ME/CFS more difficult.

content_blocks.text: There’s no simple blood test or X-ray to diagnose chronic fatigue syndrome – also known as myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS). And many of the symptoms of the illness -- deep tiredness, unrelieved by rest or sleep, feeling worse after physical or mental exertion, trouble concentrating, feeling worse after standing and remaining on one’s feet and other symptoms-- are also seen in other conditions, too, making the diagnosis of ME/CFS more difficult.

sections.heading: See Your Doctor
content: If you think you might have ME/CFS, make an appointment to see your doctor. Research shows that getting treatment sooner might bring better results.

Your doctor will ask for a lot of information about your health. Unfortunately, there is not yet a diagnostic test that is sufficiently accurate to be useful. Your doctor will need to rule out other conditions or causes before they can diagnose ME/CFS.

They might order other tests like blood and urine tests and scans. They will need the names of all the prescription and over-the-counter medicine you take, in case one of them is causing your symptoms. Also, tell your doctor if you take any supplements . Even so-called “natural” or “herbal” remedies can have side effects, and they might cause problems if used with other medications you’re taking.

Your doctor will give you a complete physical exam and ask you questions about your emotions. This will give them a better idea of what your needs are. It’s important to make sure you don’t have another disorder, which could be serious and could get better with treatment.

Even so-called “natural” or “herbal” remedies can have side effects, and they might cause problems if used with other medications you’re taking.

Your doctor will give you a complete physical exam and ask you questions about your emotions. This will give them a better idea of what your needs are. It’s important to make sure you don’t have another disorder, which could be serious and could get better with treatment.

sections.heading: What Else Could It Be?
content: Many people who have ME/CFS have other conditions, too. If you get treated for those, it might also improve your chronic fatigue.

ME/CFS can look a lot like “mono” ( mononucleosis ), Lyme disease , lupus , multiple sclerosis , fibromyalgia , sleep disorders , or depression . It affects about 2.5 million Americans, but experts believe only about 20% are diagnosed.

content_blocks.text: Many people who have ME/CFS have other conditions, too. If you get treated for those, it might also improve your chronic fatigue.

ME/CFS can look a lot like “mono” ( mononucleosis ), Lyme disease , lupus , multiple sclerosis , fibromyalgia , sleep disorders , or depression . It affects about 2.5 million Americans, but experts believe only about 20% are diagnosed.

sections.heading: Checking the Symptoms
content: Your doctor will review your medical history and test results. They will check to see if you have several key symptoms, beginning with extreme tiredness, or fatigue , that doesn’t improve with bed rest for 6 months or longer.

sections.heading: Checking the Symptoms
content: Your doctor will review your medical history and test results. They will check to see if you have several key symptoms, beginning with extreme tiredness, or fatigue , that doesn’t improve with bed rest for 6 months or longer.

content_blocks.text: Your doctor will review your medical history and test results. They will check to see if you have several key symptoms, beginning with extreme tiredness, or fatigue , that doesn’t improve with bed rest for 6 months or longer.

content: Then, your doctor will check to see if you have three of these "core" symptoms of CFS:
bullets: Reduced ability to do usual activities for six months or more because of fatigue
Worsening of symptoms (difficulty thinking, problems sleeping, sore throat, headaches, feeling dizzy, or severe tiredness). after physical or mental exertion
Trouble falling asleep or staying asleep, and awakening unrested

content_blocks.text: Then, your doctor will check to see if you have three of these "core" symptoms of CFS:
associated_bullets: Reduced ability to do usual activities for six months or more because of fatigue
Worsening of symptoms (difficulty thinking, problems sleeping, sore throat, headaches, feeling dizzy, or severe tiredness). after physical or mental exertion
Trouble falling asleep or staying asleep, and awakening unrested

content: Along with the three symptoms, you must have one of these for a diagnosis of ME/CFS:

It could take a while to get your diagnosis. It’s OK to ask how you can relieve your symptoms while you wait. Your doctor or health professional will schedule follow-up appointments to see how your treatment is working.
bullets: Worsening of symptoms while standing or sitting upright; you might feel lightheaded, dizzy or weak, and you may have blurred vision or see spots.

content_blocks.text: Along with the three symptoms, you must have one of these for a diagnosis of ME/CFS:
associated_bullets: Worsening of symptoms while standing or sitting upright; you might feel lightheaded, dizzy or weak, and you may have blurred vision or see spots.

content_blocks.text: It could take a while to get your diagnosis. It’s OK to ask how you can relieve your symptoms while you wait. Your doctor or health professional will schedule follow-up appointments to see how your treatment is working.

sources: Aaron, L. Journal of General Internal Medicine , January 2001.
meta_description: Diagnosing myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS) isn’t a simple talk. WebMD tells you what to expect.
